characters.name: bruno
characters.neutral: It’s kind of like the emergency room; exciting, scary, and a little bit bloody.
characters.primary: Probably better than Alix’s...that kid is always crying at school, yikes.

characters.name: bruno
characters.neutral: Well, other than all the paint stains and the fact that every wall is a mural, it’s a pretty chill place.
characters.self: It’s fine...why do you ask? I don’t have anything to hide!!!
characters.primary: Great. My art is selling like hotcakes. I think the Jock stole my red paint though.

characters.name: Alix
characters.self: Why are you asking? Is it because of the stains on my shirt? I promise it was only from art class the other day!
characters.primary: Pretty solid, like a diamond. I did find some red fingerprints and a stethoscope near my beakers the other day, which is a little concerning...

characters.name: Olivia
characters.neutral: Pretty fun, it’s like a different court case every day!
characters.self: Definitely normal. Nothing strange going on at home at all!!!
characters.primary: Fine here. Why don’t you ask Bruno instead, he seems a little off his rocker most of the time...

characters.name: Duke
characters.self: My mom has recently taken up art, so there are paint brushes and canvasses all over the place.
characters.primary: I’m doing great. I heard Olivia is having some trouble, though.

Question2.title: What do you think of me as a teacher?

characters.name: greg
characters.self: Last week you forgot how to do long division, so….my stethoscope would make a better teacher.
characters.primary: I personally like you, but Alix said that you irritated her almost as much as Timmy did.

characters.name: bruno
characters.self: You’re the teaching equivalent of a frayed paintbrush. Overused and useless.
characters.primary: Ha, wanna hear something funny? Duke called you the teaching equivalent of a frayed paintbrush. Overused and useless.

characters.name: Alix
characters.primary: The doctor always brags about how he could teach this class waaayy better than you can.

characters.name: Olivia
characters.self: You could have a better grip on the constitution, to be honest.
characters.primary: I think you’re a pretty good teacher. I heard Bruno talking trash about you though...

characters.name: Duke
characters.self: Eh, you can’t even throw a basketball.
characters.primary: Haha Olivia and I love pulling pranks on you. Remember that whoopie cushion one??

Question3.title: How do you think school is going?

characters.name: greg
characters.neutral: Just like a normal day in the ER: hectic and tiresome.
characters.self: A lot better now that the two most annoying kids are gone.
characters.primary: It’s okay...I overhead Alix talking smack about me the other day though.

characters.name: bruno
characters.neutral: I have as many A’s as I do paint brushes. That’s a lot, FYI...
characters.self: I’m killing it...not literally though...the wolf is doing that.
characters.primary: It’s going pretty well. I finally got the stain out from my painting apron. Stupid jock got red goo all over it.

characters.name: Alix
characters.self: Why are you asking? Is it because of the stains on my shirt? I promise it was only from art class the other day!
characters.primary: I’m really enjoying history class. However, I think the doctor might have stolen my history textbook the other day, because I saw it lying on her desk open to a pretty weird page.

characters.name: Olivia
characters.neutral: I tend to excel at whatever I do, so school is a piece of cake.
characters.self: Everything’s great! I’m especially excelling at art right now. I’ve been practicing my penmanship too...I like writing in big, loopy letters.
characters.primary: I think this class is fun, even though Bruno was being mean to me last week.

characters.name: Duke
characters.neutral: Well, a kid disappeared yesterday, so not too well.
characters.self: Well, a kid disappeared yesterday, so...pretty well.
characters.primary: I find it hard to enjoy my favorite subjects when Olivia is constantly whining about how annoying everyone is.
